thread.title: Switch for GEAR UP Grant Approved By Feds
thread.title_full: Switch for GEAR UP Grant Approved By Feds

title: Switch for GEAR UP Grant Approved By Feds
text:
Switch for GEAR UP Grant Approved By Feds October 19, 2015, 12:57 PM by Angela Kennecke PIERRE, SD - 
The U.S. Department of Education has approved the South Dakota Department of Education's request for the South Dakota Board of Regents to administer GEAR UP grant funds. 
The Board of Regents will now distribute the funds for the program that is designed to direct Native American Students toward higher education. 
According to Governor Dennis Daugaard's office, now that the change has been approved, a timeline for the transition and a budget for the coming year will be worked out between the state and federal departments of education and the Board of Regents. 
The South Dakota Department of Education pulled the $4.3-million GEAR UP grant from Mid Central Educational Cooperative on September 16 after troubling financial audits.
